intro: Raveniopsis paruana, commonly known as the Parana raveniopsis, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found near rivers and wetlands. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside its native habitat.
